remarks: Lemma for ~ lcfr .  The set of functionals having closed kernels and majorizing the orthocomplement of a given subspace ` Q ` is closed under scalar product.  TODO: share hypotheses with others.  Use more consistent variable names here or elsewhere when possible.  (Contributed by NM, 5-Mar-2015.)
statement:
lcfrlem5.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
lcfrlem5.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lcfrlem5.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lcfrlem5.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
lcfrlem5.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
lcfrlem5.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
lcfrlem5.d $e |- D = ( LDual ` U ) $.
lcfrlem5.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` D ) $.
lcfrlem5.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
lcfrlem5.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. S ) $.
lcfrlem5.q $e |- Q = U_ f e. R ( ._|_ ` ( L ` f ) ) $.
lcfrlem5.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. Q ) $.
lcfrlem5.c $e |- C = ( Scalar ` U ) $.
lcfrlem5.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
lcfrlem5.t $e |- .x. = ( .s ` U ) $.
lcfrlem5.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. B ) $.
lcfrlem5 $p |- ( ph -> ( A .x. X ) e. Q ) $.
$d .x. f $.
$d A f $.
$d X f $.
$d f ph $.
